title: Energy and Environment for Chemistry Teachers
description: This course will cover selected energy resources (renewable and non-renewable) and the environmental impacts of their production, transport and use. Connections to relevant examples will be made and recent national initiatives such as the Singapore Green Plan will be discussed to provide real world context. The content of this course will be suitable for “O” and “A” level chemistry teachers to refresh and increase their knowledge of energy and the environment.
prerequisite: Completed a Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry or a related subject
